definition: hands tied and waiting to be captured
surname Shu
to bind/bunch/bundle/classifier for bunches, bundles, beams of light etc/to control
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
to capture

sentences.english: But Liverpool cannot afford to lose and Benítez has just described the game as the key to the rest of the season.
sentences.chinese: 但是利物浦是不会束手就擒的。

sentences.english: Mu Zhixiao of one's proper business, not dare defy, be seized without fighting.
sentences.chinese: 正事母至孝，不敢违抗，束手就擒。

sentences.english: We're not doing well at all, they concluded.
sentences.chinese: 他们如此总结，我们束手就擒。

sentences.english: For females in particular, a negative response may be better than no response at all.
sentences.chinese: 尤其对于女性，消极抵抗也许比束手就擒更好。

definition: to be taken prisoner
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
to extend one's neck in preparation for execution (idiom)
to have one's hands tied/helpless/unable to do anything about it
to sit and wait for death (idiom); resigned to one's fate
stupid/stubborn/pigheaded
to submit/to give in
life/to survive/to save a life/to scrape a living
to give up
to kneel and beg forgiveness
to walk right into the trap
to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
to concede/to admit defeat
(idiom) dead end/road to ruin
to escape/to flee/to run away
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
